answerText: vectors[10] This function takes two vectors and outputs a single number by summing the products of their corresponding coordinates. If this function is zero, then the vectors are perpendicular.
heading: ICCS |2014 | 9 | 15 | Science | Math | College
subject: Science
question: Question: When represented as coordinates, these entities can be thought of as the arrow connecting the origin to that coordinate.  [10] Identify these things that, unlike scalars, have both a magnitude and a direction.
